original: PÅLEN, Anders Gustav Paul, Bergsingenjör, Saltsjöbaden, f Garpenberg, Kopparb l, 4/4 81 av kontr.prost S G P o Charlotte Nystedt, gm Ewa Mathiasson. Studex Vvik 99, KTH 03. Bitr ing Falu kopparvk 03, kem Nautanens kopparvk 05, rit Le Lamar Copper Re-fining Co USA 05—06, mill foreman Elkhorn Silver Mining Co Montana 06, kem, provn.-ing o superint v öl gruvbol USA 06—12, driftsbestyrer Kristiansands nikkelraffin 12, chefskem Luossav-Kiirunav AB Kiruna 12— 16, ing AB Kopparextraktion 16—20, d :o Pa-teutAB Jtingners kalicement 20—23, vkst dir AB Jungnerkali 23—26, deläg fma Birger Carlson & Co 24—28, övering Skellefteå gruvAB 26—31, d:o Bolidens gruvAB 31—41 (har bl a lett uppf o igångsätt av Rönnskärs smältvk), spec.lär i metallhyttk v KTH sed. 38, konsult metallurg. Ordf Birger Carlsons fabr.AB, jourhav styr.led Birger Carlson & Co AB; ordf Saltsjöb :s skyt.frn o Fören f olymp kortdist.skjutn i Sthlm. Resor: USA, Canada o Mexico 9 ggr 05—35, Egypt 36, Brasil, Uruguay, Argent, Cape Colony o Transvaal 37, europ länd uppr ggr. Av trycket: Medarb Nord Fam.b 2. uppl o Uppfinn:s bok (28), upps i metallurgi mm. RVO, GV:sOlM, FOK ftjGM, skyt.GM o gm, pist.skyt.gm, Norrb skyt.frbs ftjSM, simmag g mm. Hobbies: Segling, Skytte. °PALM, Carl-Filip, överingenjör, Norrsundet, f Örebro 2/11 94. Realex öbr 11, ingex tekn sk öbr 16, prakt v verkst o pappersbruk. Driftsing v St Koppparb Bergsl AB:s cellu-losafabr:r i Skutskär 17—24, övering o pl.chef v Kopparfors AB, Norrsundets Sulfatfabr, sed. 24. Led av rådgiv kté i Cellulosaind :s Centrallab. Studie- o aff.resor i Europa o USA.
translated:
PÅLEN, Anders Gustav Paul, Mining Engineer, Saltsjöbaden, born in Garpenberg, Kopparberg county, on April 4, 1881, to contracting priest S.G.P and Charlotte Nystedt. Married to Ewa Mathiasson. Studied at Vvik in 1899 and KTH in 1903. Assistant engineer at Falu copper works in 1903, chemist at Nautanen's copper works in 1905, draftsman at Le Lamar Copper Refining Co, USA, from 1905 to 1906, mill foreman at Elkhorn Silver Mining Co, Montana, in 1906, chemist, tester, and superintendent at various mining companies in the USA from 1906 to 1912. Manager of Kristiansand nickel refining in 1912, chief chemist at Luossav-Kiirunav AB, Kiruna, from 1912 to 1916, engineer at AB Kopparextraktion from 1916 to 1920, director at Pa-teut AB Jtingners kalicement from 1920 to 1923, head director at AB Jungnerkali from 1923 to 1926, co-owner of Birger Carlson & Co from 1924 to 1928, supervisor at Skellefteå mining AB from 1926 to 1931, supervisor at Bolidens mining AB from 1931 to 1941 (among other things, led the construction and commencement of Rönnskär smelter works), special instructor in metallurgical furnace work at KTH since 1938, metallurgical consultant. Chairman of Birger Carlsons fabrik AB, board member of Birger Carlson & Co AB. Chairman of the Saltsjöbaden shooting fraternity and the Society for Olympic short-distance shooting in Stockholm. Traveled to the USA, Canada, and Mexico 9 times from 1905 to 1935, Egypt in 1936, Brazil, Uruguay, Argentina, Cape Colony, and Transvaal in 1937, various European countries several times. Published articles in Nordisk Familjebok (second edition) and in books about inventions (1928), and contributed to metallurgical works, etc. Received Royal Order of Vasa, Royal Order of the Polar Star, Commander of the Royal Order of the Beneficence, Gold Medal for marksmanship, and pistol shooting medal, Norrland rifle brigade silver badge shooting medal, swimming awards, etc. Hobbies: Sailing, Shooting.

PALM, Carl-Filip, Chief Engineer, Norrsundet, born in Örebro on November 2, 1894. Completed secondary education in 1911, technical school for engineering in 1916, practical experience in workshops and paper mills. Operating engineer at Stora Kopparberg's cellulose factory in Skutskär from 1917 to 1924, chief engineer and plant manager at Kopparfors AB, Norrsundets Sulfate factory since 1924. Member of the advisory committee at the Central Laboratory of the Cellulose Industry. Traveled for study and business purposes in Europe and the USA.

Note: The abbreviation "gm" stands for "gift med," which means "married to."
